oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. James Cumberland Presbyterian: fieldnotes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fieldnotes of St. James Cumberland Presbyterian Church. Notes document the building phases of the church and provide basic information about the church.

Organized in 1879, Saint James Cumberland Presbyterian Church still retains its original sanctuary building. The current building reflects several periods of remodeling: July 1906 through August 25, 1907 under the leadership of Reverend T.J. Fletcher; remodeling ending on August 26, 1945 under the leadership of Reverend H.A. Sheeler; educational building addition dedicated on March 3, 1959 under the leadership of Reverend L.B. Tinsley; and fellowship hall/multi-purpose building dedicated on October 29, 1995 under the leadership of Reverend Dr. Mitchell Walker, Sr.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
